meanings.sent1: The party was filled with debauchery, with people dancing and drinking all night.
meanings.sent2: His life of debauchery led to health problems and financial ruin.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed a comical scene of debauchery at a wild bachelor party.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a playground for debauchery, with neon lights and loud music.
meanings.sent5: The novel described the debauchery of the royal court in vivid detail.

meanings.definition: Corrupting or leading astray from moral conduct.
meanings.sent1: She warned her friend about the debauchery influence of the new crowd she was hanging out with.
meanings.sent2: The debauchery lifestyle of the rock star shocked the conservative town.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the debauchery politicians getting caught in scandals.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley held a debauchery secret that would change his life forever.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a debauchery past that haunted its halls.

meanings.sent1: His reputation for debauchery preceded him wherever he went.
meanings.sent2: The debauchery of the group was evident in their wild parties and reckless actions.
meanings.sent3: The town gossiped about the debauchery of the local troublemaker.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned mansion was a symbol of debauchery and decay.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the essence of debauchery with its chaotic brushstrokes.
